video.title: TEDTalks: How to Start a Movement
video.synopsis: With optimism and hope, social activists present tactics for motivating change in governments, businesses, domestic situations and other struggles.

episodes.synopsis: A year after Internet activist Aaron Swartz's death, Lawrence Lessig continues his campaign to free U.S. politics from the stranglehold of corruption.
episodes.title: Lawrence Lessig: The Unstoppable Walk to Political Reform

episodes.synopsis: Management theorist Simon Sinek suggests that a great leader is someone who makes employees feel secure, who draws staffers into a circle of trust.
episodes.title: Simon Sinek: Why Good Leaders Make You Feel Safe

episodes.synopsis: Beirut International Marathon founder May El-Khalil explains why she believed the event could, for one day, unite a country divided for decades.
episodes.title: May El-Khalil: Making Peace Is a Marathon

episodes.synopsis: JR, a semi-anonymous French street artist, pastes photos of human faces across massive canvases; here, he uses his art to turn the world inside out.
episodes.title: JR: My Wish: Use Art to Turn the World Inside Out

episodes.synopsis: When war between Israel and Iran seemed imminent, Israeli graphic designer Ronny Edry's message of love to all Iranians inspired online communities.
episodes.title: Ronny Edry: Israel and Iran: A Love Story?

episodes.synopsis: A year after his TED Prize wish, JR shows how giant posters of human faces, pasted in public, are connecting communities and making change.
episodes.title: JR: One Year of Turning the World Inside Out

episodes.synopsis: Esta Soler's sweeping, optimistic talk charts 30 years of tactics and technologies that led to a 64 percent drop in domestic violence in the U.S.
episodes.title: Esta Soler: How We Turned the Tide on Domestic Violence (Hint: the Polaroid Helped)

episodes.synopsis: Fascinated by the overlaps and tensions between the gay rights and civil rights movements, filmmaker Yoruba Richen explores how the two intertwine.
episodes.title: Yoruba Richen: What the Gay Rights Movement Learned from the Civil Rights Movement
